page.title: 15Little Liverpool
page.content: Little Liverpool is situated to the south-west of Coton-in-the-Elms and 1.5km north west of Lullington. It consists of a group of about 3 houses. Residents believe the area derived its name from a group of sailors, originally from Liverpool. They are thought to have sailed up the R. Trent and from there headed towards Botany Bay.They decided to settle in the vicinity and the name Little Liverpool was retained. Grafton House, just south of Little Liverpool was the local spa. Unfortunately the wells were filled in with the arrival of a mains water supply in the 1940's.
